message:
Gymkhana Awards 2018-19 | Technology

Application for the Gymkhana Awards in the genre of Technology are invited for:

1. G.S. Sanyal Cup 
2. Institute Order of Merit
3. Honourable Mention

In the resumes following information can be included:

*  Inter IIT Participation and achievement if any
*  Participation in the Technology General Championship and achievement if any
*  National/International Conference, International Competitions and achievement if any.
*  Meaningful projects and technical paper.
*  Positions of Responsibility held at the Gymkhana or any other organisation in the Institute.
*  Participation in tech events (eg. Kshitij, outstation participation)

Mail your resumes and relevant documents (for the verification of credentials) to tech.gymkhana@gmail.com at the earliest.

Application Deadline - 9th April 2018, 12:00 PM.

No applications beyond the deadline will be entertained.

Sub: Complaint against Exide Life insurance for fraudulent activities 

Request for Cancellation of policy no: 03747862, 03747894, 03780493 & 03780492

Respected  Sir,

This has reference to my above complaint I am sending you mail by explaining in details: 

I beg to state that myself Dilip Kumar Dutta (63 years old)  is residing at 2/63 Vidyasagar Colony, Naktala, P.S- Netaji Nagar thana, Vidyasagar Colony Bus Stand, Kolkata - 700047 is complaining against Exide Life Insurance and their employee Baburam Mahapatra (BM, Exidelife of Golpark branch, Kolkata).

They cheated me by taking my hard earned money which I got from my retirement benefit. They told me that to take one time(single)   policy from Exide Life insurance which would be as like as bank FD and I would get Rs. 24000/- PM as interest. They told me that it could be encash anytime whenever I wish as like as bank FD.

They added that to inform them when I would received my one time policy bond at my residence and that should be kept in their custody/Exide branch without cutting that one time policy/FD bond's envelope  to process my interest@24000/-pm. 

And as per their advice I had handed over my 4 nos of above one time policy/FD bond (Sealed envelope)  to Baburam Mahapatra when I had received it without cutting all envelope.

When I had not received any interest which they had committed to me Rs.24000/-pm since this long time (6 months time) then I discussed with my family and friends regarding their forgery. My family and friends told me that I had been cheated by Baburam Mahapatra and also I come to know that several senior citizens people have been cheated by them.

I requested them several times to return back my all one time policy/FD bond to me but all time they said that my interest@24000/-pm was in process at HO and all my bond were required for it. They also told me that it would take time (4-5 months) initially and I would get accumulated interest (4-5 months) in my bank account and all one time bond all together. 

When I shouted them that time Baburam Mahapatra have given me 4 nos of above my policy/FD bond by the first week of previous  month  and I become faint by seeing of this said bond.

I found that all of above said one time Exide life policy bond(which they said)  are recurring policies like LIC which I have to pay for that said term else all policies will be lapsed on 2nd year onwards.
I have not a single paise to pay premium on 2nd year, I had invested all my savings at Exide life Insurance  as per Baburam Mahapatra's commitment that I would get interest@24000/- pm.

Policy details are mentioned below:

1.Policy No:  03747862 Rs.: 750000/- for 10 years premium payment term. 

2. Policy No: 03747894 Rs: 750000/- for 10 years premium payment term.

3. Policy No: 03780492 Rs: 48000/- for 5 years premium payment term and maturity at 15 years.

4. Policy No: 03780493 Rs. 500000/-for 5 years premium payment term and maturity at 20 years.

Baburam Mahapatra had taken my above amount Rs.:2048000/- which I have earned from my retirement benefit and that i had kept in my bank as FD. He told me that Exide Life has started banking business and people could invest here as bank Fixed deposit (one time) and interest (10-12%) would be credited in my bank account in monthly basis.

I come to know that Baburam Mahapatra  is a big culprit and big cheater who are cheating every senior citizens people by sitting at  Exide life Golpark branch, Kolkata  office day to day. And Exide life insurance  are supporting his all fraudulent activities. He can do all this fraudulent activities by getting support from his bosses. They have a good understanding with each other regarding agents/employee's payout which they are taking day to day. This is very very unfortunate that Exide life insurance such a IRDA listed company are recruiting such fraud, cheater people like Baburam Mahapatra and have given such a senior label position like Branch Manager. Every common people like me should trust a Branch Manager of a listed co.

After taking 30 days of time customers care people  mailed that they would  not cancel my above policies.  Mr Joydeep Banerjee called me,  i told him that your fraud employee Baburam Mahapatra cheated me by getting support from Exide co. He had taken all bonds (in sealed envelope position) when that i received. And he returned all bonds first week of previous  month. I couldn't check their terms and conditions which they are telling now, Baburam Mahapatra intentionally done it, he knew that i must cancel all bonds if i able to see their terms & conditions that time when i received that. 

BABURAM MAHAPATRA DIDN'T GIVE ME SCOPE FOR CANCELLATION AT FREE LOOK PERIOD. 

I am a retired person (63 years old) & got above all money as retirement benefit and had kept in bank (FD) & was getting interest from bank per month for which I was maintaining my family.

Now I am totally helpless and not have a single paise to buy medicines for me and my wife. We are heart patient and have high blood sugar and high blood pressure.

Without any medical test Exide Life Insurance issued my all policies. They did false medical where as me and my spouse is heart patient. All information in bond are false. This all things happened by Baburam Mahapatra without taking my consent. 

I write to request to arrange for cancellation  above all policies and kindly refund my money Rs: 2048000/- and obliged. 

Yours faithfully,

Dilip Kumar Dutta

7th Inter IIT Tech Meet

The Inter IIT Tech Meet will be held from 18th December 2018 to 20th December 2018 at IIT Bombay. The problem statements for the events have been released and can be found at http://inter-iit.tech/ 
Please go through the problem statements, people with relevant experience(s) can apply by sending in their applications (CV and Cover Letter- concisely containing their potential contributions and experiences- along with the valid proofs) at tech.gymkhana@gmail.com 
The subject of the email should be [Event Name] [Name] [Roll Number].
Deadline: 13th October 2018, 11:59pm

Note:
- One student can apply in at most 3 events, and they should mention the priority order in the body of each of the emails of the events they are applying to.
- Please attach the valid proofs in a single zip file.
- Please keep the cover letter concise and to-the-point, mentioning your relevant skills and potential contributions you can make.
- Since the Tech Meet is being held in December, the selected people might have to stay in the campus in December based on the preparation required for the event.

Technology, IIT Kharagpur welcomes the General Secretaries, Technology's for the academic session 2018-19, Argha Paul and Sai Rakesh Mogillapalle .
We are certain that you will strive for the betterment of the already strong technical culture at IIT Kharagpur, and hope you will lead our contingent to put up a yet another brilliant performance at the 7th Inter IIT Tech Meet.
We also hope you will head the organisation of a smooth Technology General Championship 2018-19.  

On behalf of Technology Students’ Gymkhana, we wish the both of you a very fruitful tenure ahead.

Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses. The SIH was primarily a code-fest in which software programmers were challenged to write programmes giving innovative solutions to more than 500 problem statements. The SIH-2017 elicited an enthusiastic response with more than 40,000 students participating. It was concluded in the first week of April 2017 with Hon’ble PM addressing the participants. This is being followed with Smart India Hackathon-2018 which was formally launched details of which can be found in https://innovate.mygov.in/sih2018/.

The MHRD now proposes to expand the scope of SIH-2018 by including hardware section in it. This platform will provide an opportunity to the innovative minds to showcase their solutions at the national level. It is also proposed that the best entries at the national level would also be provided funding through the Research Parks and the Technology Business Incubators (TBIs) for product development for their eventual commercialisation/extensive social use.

The MHRD expects a good participation in this Hackathon from all the IITs and NITs.
All students are requested to provide ideas (with or without models/prototypes) that will be proposed as problem statements of the Smart India Hackathon 2018. This should be done by mailing the idea totech.gymkhana@gmail.com by 13th November, 2 AM.

You are also requested to go through the 400+ problem statements provided in the aforementioned link and register for the Hackathon. The problem statements are both software and hardware based.

Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Transfer Group , IIT Kharagpur's photo. In continuation of the ongoing Patent Drive, efforts are being made to protect the inventions by the students and researchers. We would like to identify and protect the technologies to be displayed in the upcoming Techno-management festival Kshitij™. In this regard all the institute participants of Kshitij events especially (i) Eureka, (ii) Embetronics, (iii) Droid Blitz, (iv) Conquest, (v) Arm Of Achelous, (vi) Sandrover, (vii) B.R.I.C.K.S, (viii) Kryotech, (ix) Anadigix and (x) Initiative Prakriti are requested to send an abstract along with required drawings of their invention to submissions@ktj.in. "The deadline for the institute participants has been exclusively extended up to the 12th of Jan " The patentable inventions will be recommended for filing after scrutiny by the expert techno-legal committee. Please be assured that Institute will provide all necessary support to protect your valuable inventions. Please note that all your valuable inventions need to be protected by filing the patent before disclosing to the public. This is an excellent opportunity to protect and look for the possible marketability and commercial viability of your inventions. Such protection prevents the unauthorized use of your invention and provides a meaningful exclusionary right to the patent holder. The details of Kshitij events can be found in the following link: http://ktj.in/#ktj/Events

Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India. Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpedia.in. Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity: Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016 You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@sristi.org ,or call at 9099258492.

1) Prof. G S Sanyal Cup.

*National/International conferences.

message:
A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in/replay/webcastShow.html?key=vUUIZ1dDHHitrBr

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.
